modules.title: Module 1: Overview & Prerequisites
modules.overview: Earn yield using stable LPs, lending, and auto-compounding vaults. This module orients you to safe venues, the wallet setup, and the exact prerequisites before depositing.
prerequisites: Fund gas on the target chain (ETH on Ethereum, MATIC on Polygon, BNB on BNB Chain).
Have a small test amount ready (e.g., $50–$100) for first deposit.
Bookmark the protocols you plan to use (e.g., Aave, Curve, Beefy).
steps: Open DeFi Hub → Passive Income.
Pick a chain (Ethereum, Polygon, or BNB Chain).
Select one conservative strategy (e.g., Aave USDC lending or Curve DAI/USDC LP).
Click “View Steps” to expand the deposit guide.
Approve the token (one-time) then deposit a small test amount.
Enable auto-compound (if available) and confirm in your wallet.
Write down the protocol URL, deposit date, expected APY, and risks in your notes.
modules.notes_prompt: Record your funding source, gas cost, and which protocol you deposited into. Add any questions for the next module.

modules.title: Module 2: Wallet & Safety Setup
modules.overview: Harden your wallet, set spending limits, and learn safe approval habits before interacting with DeFi.
prerequisites: MetaMask installed and backed up (seed phrase offline).
steps: Create a dedicated DeFi wallet; keep the trading wallet separate.
Add the target networks in MetaMask (Ethereum, Polygon, BNB).
Set custom spending caps when approving tokens (avoid unlimited).
Use revoke tools to view and remove old allowances.
Save your protocol list and official URLs in bookmarks only (avoid search-engine phishing).
modules.notes_prompt: List your connected networks and which allowances you revoked today.

modules.title: Module 3: On/Off-Ramps & Bridging
modules.overview: Move funds safely from fiat to crypto, then bridge to the target chain with minimal fees and errors.
prerequisites: KYC and bank connection with a reputable on-ramp (CeFi or fiat on-ramp).
steps: Buy USDC/USDT on your on-ramp (or centralized exchange).
Withdraw to your self-custody wallet on the correct network (double-check address and chain).
If needed, bridge stablecoins to the target chain using a reputable bridge.
Send a small test first, then the main amount once confirmed.
Record tx hashes and bridge URLs in your notes.
modules.notes_prompt: Document which on-ramp/bridge you used, fees paid, and total time.

modules.title: Module 4: Lending with Aave (Deposit/Withdraw)
modules.overview: Learn to deposit, earn yield, and withdraw safely using Aave lending markets for stablecoins.
prerequisites: USDC or DAI in your wallet on the target chain.
Gas token funded for the chain.
steps: Open Aave UI and connect your wallet.
Select the stablecoin market (e.g., USDC on Polygon).
Approve the token spending cap (set a cap, avoid unlimited).
Deposit a small test amount (e.g., $50) to confirm flow.
Check the dashboard for APY and health metrics.
Practice a partial withdrawal back to your wallet.
modules.notes_prompt: Record deposit APY, health factor, and your first withdraw test hash.

modules.title: Module 5: LP Basics with Curve (DAI/USDC)
modules.overview: Provide liquidity to a stable pool on Curve, understand IL (low for stables), and claim rewards if applicable.
prerequisites: DAI and USDC in your wallet on the target chain.
steps: Open Curve and locate the DAI/USDC pool on your chain.
Add liquidity with a small test first; note the minimum received amounts.
Stake LP tokens if the pool offers boosted rewards (optional).
Record your LP token balance and pool share.
Practice removing a small portion of liquidity to confirm exits.
modules.notes_prompt: Write down pool name, your share %, expected APR, and the staking option used.

modules.title: Module 6: Auto-Compounding Vaults (Beefy)
modules.overview: Use a reputable vault (e.g., Beefy) to auto-compound LP or lending yields and understand associated risks/fees.
prerequisites: Have LP tokens (from Module 5) or a supported token for vault deposit.
steps: Open Beefy, connect your wallet, and find the matching vault for your asset/LP.
Review the vault’s performance fee and compounding frequency.
Approve and deposit a small test amount into the vault.
Confirm auto-compounding status and review the expected APY.
Test a small withdrawal to ensure the flow back to your wallet.
modules.notes_prompt: Record the vault name, fees, APY, and a link to the vault page for tracking.

modules.title: Module 7: Monitoring, APY Decay & Rotation
modules.overview: Create a weekly routine to monitor positions, detect APY decay, and rotate into better risk-adjusted yields.
prerequisites: Have at least one live position (lending/LP/vault).
steps: Review your positions weekly; record APY/APR and any fee changes.
If APY decays or risks rise, plan a rotation into a safer or higher-quality pool.
Check audits/news for each protocol (upgrade notices, incidents).
Update your notes with realized weekly yield and any adjustments made.
modules.notes_prompt: Summarize your weekly changes and the reason for any rotation.

modules.title: Module 8: Exiting, Reports & Automation
modules.overview: Practice safe exits, export reports, and set automation/alerts for hands-off monitoring.
prerequisites: One or more positions to exit or trim.
steps: Practice a partial exit: withdraw a portion of your position and convert to stablecoin.
Export a weekly/monthly report (CSV/JSON) with deposits, withdrawals, and realized yield.
Set price/APY alerts and configure email/Telegram notifications.
Create a recurring calendar reminder for your weekly DeFi review.
modules.notes_prompt: Record realized yield, fees, and your new stablecoin allocation plan.
